New Records: The Lakers achieved their first 2-0 start since 2010-11.
Key Match Events: The Lakers trailed by 22 points in the second quarter but outscored Phoenix 35-24 in the third quarter to take the lead.
The Lakers scored nine straight points to grab the lead in the third quarter, part of a 20-6 run during a nearly five-minute span from late in the third to early in the fourth.
Anthony Davis and LeBron James each scored 11 points in the third quarter.
Post-Match Reflections: JJ Redick is the first Los Angeles coach to win his first two games since Phil Jackson in 1999.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Suns made 21 of their first 30 shots, including nine straight 3-pointers, before going 21 of 52 the rest of the game.
The Lakers were 14 of 27 on 3-pointers, with Austin Reaves going 5 of 7 from beyond the arc and LeBron James, Dalton Knecht, and Rui Hachimura making two apiece.
Others: Anthony Davis scored 35 points, Austin Reaves added 26, and LeBron James had 21 points for the Lakers.
Kevin Durant led Phoenix with 30 points, and Devin Booker had 23.
The Lakers will face Sacramento next, and the Suns will face Dallas.
